acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Not classified from its 96h-LC50 = 2200 - 4600 mg/L for fish (Golden orfe), 24h-EC50 >100 mg/L for Crustacea (Daphnia magna), 72h-EC50 = 510 mg/L for algae (Scenedesmus) (IUCLID, 2000 for any).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >20 mL/kg (>15000 mg/kg) for rabbits (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the result of no mortality (0/6) in rats exposed at 64,000 ppm (vapour) for 4-hour (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified as "Not classified". Since the vapour concentration was lower than 90% of saturated vapour pressure concentration (672,368 ppm), the substance was determined as "vapour with almost no included mists", and classification criteria for gas was adopted.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of 8.16 mL/kg (6153 mg/kg) for rats (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Not classified since its acute toxicity is Not classified and it is not non-water soluble (water solubility = 10000 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2010)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid (low boiling point) substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified into Category 1 from flash point -45 degC (IUCLID (2000)) and initial boiling point 35 degC (Lange (16th, 2005). The substance is classified into Class 3, PG I in UNRTDG (UN1302).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data from in vivo mutagenicity tests. From in vitro mutagenicity tests, there is a report of a negative Ames test (IUCLID (2000)).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Auto-ignition point is 180 degC (IUCLID (2000)) exceeding 70 degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified into Type G since the substance added stabilizer (potassium hydroxide) is being distributed and is classified into Class 3, PG I in UNRTDG (UN1302) though there are chemical groups (unsaturated hydrocarbon) present in the molecule associated with self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on a report of "not irritating" in a rabbit test (OECD TG405) (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on reports of grade 1 (maximum grade 10) irritation after open application to the skin of rabbits (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and not irritating in another rabbit test (OECD TG404), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is a report that the substance concentration necessary to produce surgical anesthesia by inhalation is 6% (PATTY (5th, 2001)). An anesthesia effect was observed in 50 % of mice following exposure to substance vapour at a concentration of 108 mg/L for 15 min (IUCLID (2000)). No pathological changes in the liver and kidney were observed in rats at 2 weeks after 15-minute anaesthesia with the substance and no liver dysfunction was observed in dogs and monkeys after 60-minute anaesthesia with the substance (IUCLID (2000)). Since narcotic effects were observed without other toxic effects, the substance was classified into Category 3 (narcotic effects).
